name: James P. Bagrow
content: James Bagrow James Bagrow Research Teaching Publications Blog Research Teaching Publications Blog Associate Professor Mathematics & Statistics and Vermont Complex Systems Center, Innovation E426, University of Vermont james.bagrow [at] uvm.edu Curriculum Vitae Mastodon News July 2025: Our paper on Recommendations for sharing network data and materials received a 2025 SIPS Commendation from The Society for the Improvement of Psychological Science. June 2024: Data scientists working with networks! Network scientists working with data! At long last, my new textbook, Working with Network Data is out. Available now from Cambridge University Press. Find out more. May 2022: Our study on the interplay between travel and sleep is the cover article of the May 2022 issue of Nature Human Behaviour! All news Research I'm interested in the underlying rules and organizing principles of complex physical and social systems. My work combines mathematical models with large-scale data analysis to better understand these systems, with a particular emphasis on network science and human dynamics.
